page.title: 01 PORT SUNLIGHT
page.content: {Port Sunlight}is a village in{ {Merseyside}not far from{Birkenhead. {William Hesketh Lever}chose Port Sunlight as the place to open up a soap factory. This was called{Lever} {Brother's. }People who worked at the factory were given a{house}by Levers. These houses were mostly in Tudor design, there are a number of continental designs too. The building's were built between 1888 and 1930. There were seven houses to an acre which cost Â£200 each.{ Church {Drive Primary School}was opened in 1902, originally children whose parents did not work for Levers were refused entry to the school. {The Lady {Lever Art Gallery}is an art gallery in Port Sunlight. It is one of the largest in Merseyside. It was opened by William Hesketh Lever after the death of his wife.
